title: Executive Order 5598-Coal Land Restoration, New Mexico No. 48
content: So much of Executive order of May 18, 1911, creating Coal Land Withdrawal, New Mexico No. 6, as affects the land hereinafter described is hereby revoked in aid of an authorized exchange of lands under the act of March 3, 1921 (41 Stat. 1225-1239):
T. 19 N., R. 10 W., sec. 4, all;
sec. 10, N. ½ N. ½, SE. ¼ NE. ¼, SW. ¼ NW. ¼, NE. ¼ SE. ¼, NW. ¼ SW. ¼, S. ½ S. ½;
sec. 26, SW. ¼, W. ½ SE. ¼, SE. ¼ SE. ¼;
sec. 28, N. ½, SW. ¼, N. ½ SE. ¼, SW. ¼ SE. ¼;
T. 18 N., R. 11 W., sec. 4, all;
T. 19 N., R. 11 W., sec. 4, all;
sec. 26, NE. ¼, N. ½ NW. ¼, SE. ¼ NW. ¼, S. ½;
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5598-Coal Land Restoration, New Mexico No. 48 Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/361364
